p: The epidemic basic reproductive number (R 0) was estimated from monthly confirmed cases, as previously described [ 32, 44]. Because ( i) the Asian genotype was circulating in the north region of Brazil since 2014 [ 1], and ( ii) we observed a relatively small number of cases both in the notified and confirmed time series, we assume cases from June 2014 and December 2016 did not represent autochthonous transmission of CHIVK-ECSA. We assume a mean generation time of 14 days, as previously reported elsewhere for an outbreak caused by an Indian Ocean lineage (IOL), a subclade of the ECSA genotype [ 45]. We report R 0 estimates for different values of the generation time (g) parameter, along with corresponding estimates of the epidemic exponential growth rate, per month (r).
